input_text:
For the eight counties listed below, what was the median number of students in $2005?$

\begin{tabular}[t]{|l|c|c|c|c|c|}
\multicolumn{6}{c}{\textbf{Number of Students per County}}\\\hline
\textbf{COUNTY}&\textbf{$2001$}&\textbf{$2002$}&\textbf{$2003$}&\textbf{$2004$}&\textbf{$2005$}\\\hline
Aiken&124&141&130&143&136\\\hline
Bamberg&17&15&15&14&11\\\hline
Barnwell&25&22&26&28&29\\\hline
Berkeley&583&557&554&553&524\\\hline
Calhoun&15&12&10&18&11\\\hline
Cherokee&19&13&18&13&19\\\hline
Chesterfield&46&18&13&22&29\\\hline
Colleton&64&49&52&46&41\\\hline
\end{tabular}

To find the median number of students in 2005 for the given eight counties, we first list the number of students per county for 2005:

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
\textbf{COUNTY} & \textbf{$2001$} & \textbf{$2002$} & \textbf{$2003$} & \textbf{$2004$} & \textbf{$2005$} \\
\hline
\textbf{Aiken} & 124 & 141 & 130 & 143 & 136 \\
\hline
\textbf{Bamberg} & 17 & 15 & 15 & 14 & 11 \\
\hline
\textbf{Barnwell} & 25 & 22 & 26 & 28 & 29 \\
\hline
\textbf{Berkeley} & 583 & 557 & 554 & 553 & 524 \\
\hline
\textbf{Calhoun} & 15 & 12 & 10 & 18 & 11 \\
\hline
\textbf{Cherokee} & 19 & 13 & 18 & 13 & 19 \\
\hline
\textbf{Chesterfield} & 46 & 18 & 13 & 22 & 29 \\
\hline
\textbf{Colleton} & 64 & 49 & 52 & 46 & 41 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]

Next, we sort these numbers in ascending order:

\[
11, 11, 19, 29, 29, 41, 136, 524
\]

Since there are 8 numbers, the median is the average of the 4th and 5th numbers. The 4th number is 29 and the 5th number is also 29. Therefore, the median is:

\[
\frac{29 + 29}{2} = 29
\]

The median number of students in 2005 is \boxed{29}.
